name: unreachable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If a place or thing is unreachable, it is not possible to get to it, or to get hold of it: The village had been unreachable because landslides had blocked the roads. Sometimes the solution is as simple as lowering the height of a table if crayons and pencils are unreachable.
If a person is unreachable, it is not possible to contact them: Some tech company offices in major cities were unreachable by phone last Tuesday.
If a level, especially a high one, is unreachable, it is not possible to achieve: After achieving a goal thought unreachable so early in the track season, Webb still has much to aim for.
More examplesFewer examplesCAT scans showed hints of trouble in a small section of his intestine unreachable by endoscopes.With whole communities still unreachable by car or telephone, officials have said they don't yet have a clear picture of the damage wrought by the storm.She said the case set a nearly unreachable standard for forest management.
